section.simpara: in Asterisk 1.2; Asterisk 1.4 users see QUEUE_MEMBER_COUNT()
section.para: Returns the number of agents (as opposed to number of callers) in the specified queue.; Number of agents in "supportqueue": exten => 123,1,Set(foo=${QUEUEAGENTCOUNT(supportqueue)})

formalpara.title: Internal help for this application in Asterisk 1.4:

para.screen:
-= Info about function 'QUEUEAGENTCOUNT' =-
[Syntax] QUEUEAGENTCOUNT(<queuename>)
[Synopsis] Count number of agents answering a queue
[Description] Returns the number of members currently associated with the specified queue. This function is deprecated. You should use QUEUE_MEMBER_COUNT() instead.
